pageContext.claim: “We have 600,000 [manufacturing jobs], and it'll be a lot higher than that when the next report comes out. And it's really been something, the manufacturing jobs.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, as usual, exaggerates the number of jobs created in his presidency by counting from the election, not when he took office. At the time of this statement, there had been about 436,000 manufacturing jobs created in his term. There has been steady growth in jobs since the Great Recession, though manufacturing job growth had stalled in the year before Trump's election. Despite Trump's prediction of a big gain in the next jobs report, only 4,000 manufacturing jobs were created in the month of February when the report was issued two days after this statement.
